summary.p: Dialogues on the Old Testament, that is, on Kings 3, Kings 4, Paralipomenon, Ezra, Tobit, Esther, Judith, Job, and Maccabee. Third part of a 3-volume manuscript: part one and two are BnF Indien 451 and BnF Indien 452.
Description based on the examination of the original manuscript (April 2021).
Dimensions assessed at the time of examination.
The images are in the reversed order on Gallica microfilm.

collation.desc: 1 folio = Callāpaṅkaḷ: Completion Statement (added to the bundle). No foliation. Double folio. Verso blank. 195 x 25 mm.
9 folios = front guard leaves. No foliation. Blank recto verso. 340 x 30 mm.
315 folios = Callāpaṅkaḷ: Text. Tamil foliation 1-315. Foliation only for f313-f315, blank recto verso. 340 x 30 mm.
10 folios = back guard leaves. No foliation. 340 x 30 mm.

additions.desc: Contents on a paper sheet inserted between front cover and U2: Dialogues sur le 3e & 4e des Roys, Paralipomenes, Esdras, Tobias, Ester, Judith, Job et les Machabees.

origin.origDate: 1729 at the latest. Dated to circa 1750 by Vinson in Vinson et al. (1866-) and to 1750 by Cabaton (1912), on unstated grounds (presumably palaeographical and material analysis arguments). Internally dated to the year 1607 of an unstated era (U3, f312r2-f312r3). It is not clear if this is the date of copy or the date copied from the master copy, if any.

provenance.p: Possibly copied in Pondicherry by Tamil Catholic converts.

acquisition.p: This manuscript appears to be the third of three volumes referred to as a single-volume Bible and Bible en Malabar ou Tamoul sent by the Jesuits of the Mission du Carnate in 1729 for the library of the king of France and mentioned in ancien lists (BnF NAF 5442, f5r and f9r). See Cabaton (1912), who dates however this manuscript to 1743. These lists state that this Bible, as well as the next two items in the list are printed by the Lutheran missionnaries from Tranquebar and are from the Danish Protestants.

S.n. 1739. Catalogus codicum manuscriptorum Bibliothecae regiae. Tomus primus. Pars prima, complectens codices manuscriptos orientales. Paris: Typographia Regia. — See p. 434, no. I.
Vinson, Julien & Feer, Léon & s.n. 1866-. Catalogue des manuscrits tamoul et télinga. Manuscript, BnF Indien 577. — See f. 103r, no. 420 453.

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.
